etymology.description: Two blocks of ice; next to a character they are compressed and stylized as 冫 (unrelated to 氵 and 次).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts two chunks of ice, conveying the meaning directly through image. When used as a left-side component in other characters, it reduces to 冫, the ice radical, distinct from the water radical 氵.

examples.chinese: 杯子里放着一块仌(杯子裡放著一塊仌)。
examples.pinyin: Bēizi lǐ fàngzhe yí kuài bīng.
examples.english: There is a piece of ice in the cup.

examples.chinese: 冬天到了，河面结成仌(冬天到了，河面結成仌)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān dào le, hémiàn jiéchéng bīng.
examples.english: Winter has arrived, and the river surface has formed ice.

examples.chinese: 他在仌上滑倒(他在仌上滑倒)。
